description: GiveTwice is a wishlist/gift list app built with Laravel 12, Blade, Tailwind CSS v4, and Alpine.js. While the codebase already uses responsive Tailwind classes across 45 files (~203 occurrences), the mobile experience has gaps: button rows overflow on narrow screens, the guest layout has no hamburger menu, the mobile nav lacks animation and accessibility, and there's no sticky header. On the PWA side, a partial manifest and icons exist, but there is no service worker — meaning the app isn't installable on Android and has no offline capability. This feature makes GiveTwice a polished mobile-first experience that users can install on their home screen (iOS and Android), browse recently viewed lists offline, and — in the future — receive push notifications.

userStories.title: Polish mobile navigation in app layout
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want a smooth, accessible hamburger menu so that I can navigate the app easily on my phone.
acceptanceCriteria: Mobile menu opens/closes with a slide-down animation (not instant show/hide)
Hamburger icon animates to an X when menu is open
Menu closes when tapping outside of it
aria-expanded attribute toggles on the hamburger button
Menu implementation uses Alpine.js (replacing vanilla JS classList.toggle)
Existing menu items (nav links, user info, dashboard, settings, logout, language switcher) all remain functional

userStories.title: Add mobile navigation to guest layout
userStories.description: As a visitor on mobile, I want a collapsible navigation on auth pages (login, register, forgot password, etc.) so that the header doesn't overflow on narrow screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Guest layout (guest.blade.php) has a hamburger menu on screens below md breakpoint
Contains: logo, How it works, About, Login, Sign up, language switcher
Matches the visual style and animation behavior of the app layout hamburger menu
All existing auth pages render correctly with the updated layout

userStories.title: Make header sticky on mobile
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want the header to stay visible as I scroll so that I can always access navigation without scrolling back to the top.
acceptanceCriteria: Header is sticky (sticky top-0) on screens below md breakpoint
Header has appropriate z-index so it layers above page content but below modals
Works correctly alongside the existing impersonation banner (which is sticky top-0 z-[60])
No content is hidden behind the sticky header on page load (offset accounted for)
On desktop, header behavior remains unchanged (static)

userStories.title: Fix dashboard action buttons for mobile
userStories.description: As a mobile user viewing my dashboard, I want the list action buttons (Edit, Collaborators, Share, Add Gift) to be usable without horizontal overflow.
acceptanceCriteria: On small screens, action buttons wrap gracefully (e.g., flex-wrap or stack vertically)
Icon-only buttons on small screens with text labels appearing at sm breakpoint, OR buttons wrap to a second row
"Add gift" button remains the most prominent CTA
No horizontal scrolling on the dashboard at 320px viewport width

userStories.title: Responsive pass on gift create/edit forms
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want the gift creation and edit forms to be comfortable to use on my phone.
acceptanceCriteria: Form fields are full-width on mobile (already grid-cols-1 on small screens — verify)
The sidebar tips section stacks below the form on mobile (already lg:grid-cols-5 — verify)
Form action buttons (Save, Cancel) are full-width or properly spaced on mobile
File upload / image area is touch-friendly (large enough tap target)
No horizontal overflow at 320px viewport width

userStories.title: Responsive pass on share and claim modals
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want modals (share link, gift detail, claim) to be easy to use on small screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Share modal: copy-link input and buttons don't overflow — buttons stack below input on narrow screens
Gift detail modal: image stacks above details on mobile (already flex-col md:flex-row — verify scroll behavior)
Gift modal is scrollable on mobile when content exceeds viewport height
Modal close button is easily tappable (minimum 44x44px touch target)
Modals use max-h-[100dvh] instead of max-h-screen to account for mobile browser chrome

userStories.title: Responsive pass on public list page
userStories.description: As a visitor viewing a shared wishlist on mobile, I want the page to look polished and be easy to browse.
acceptanceCriteria: List header (avatar, name, description) is properly sized on mobile (already has responsive classes — verify)
Stats row (available/claimed counts) doesn't overflow
Gift grid works well at 320px (2-column grid with appropriate gap)
Claim buttons are easily tappable
"How it works" steps section stacks vertically on mobile

userStories.title: Responsive pass on settings page
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want to manage my settings comfortably on my phone.
acceptanceCriteria: Profile photo upload area is properly sized and tappable on mobile
Form sections (profile info, password, connected accounts, danger zone) stack in single column on mobile (already lg:grid-cols-3 — verify)
Connected accounts section (Google/Facebook/Apple buttons) doesn't overflow
All buttons are full-width or properly spaced on mobile

userStories.title: Responsive pass on static pages
userStories.description: As a mobile visitor, I want the static pages (about, FAQ, privacy, terms, contact, transparency) to read well on my phone.
acceptanceCriteria: Text content has appropriate line length (not stretching edge-to-edge — padding is in place)
Any multi-column layouts stack on mobile
Images and cards scale properly
FAQ accordion/sections are touch-friendly
No horizontal overflow on any static page at 320px

userStories.title: Responsive pass on auth pages
userStories.description: As a mobile visitor, I want login, register, forgot password, and other auth pages to be easy to use on mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: Auth form cards are properly sized on mobile (not too narrow, not stretching)
Social login buttons (Google, Facebook, Apple) stack or fit without overflow
Form inputs are full-width on mobile
"Or continue with" divider looks clean on mobile
No horizontal overflow at 320px

userStories.title: Fix iOS background-attachment: fixed performance issue
userStories.description: As an iOS user, I want smooth scrolling without jank caused by the bg-gradient-warm background.
acceptanceCriteria: background-attachment: fixed is removed or replaced with an alternative approach on mobile (e.g., a pseudo-element with position: fixed or a simple non-fixed gradient)
The visual appearance of the warm gradient background is preserved on desktop
Scrolling is smooth on iOS Safari

userStories.title: Add safe area insets for PWA standalone mode
userStories.description: As a user running GiveTwice as a standalone PWA (especially on iPhone with notch/Dynamic Island), I want content to respect safe area insets so nothing is hidden behind the notch or home indicator.
acceptanceCriteria: viewport-fit=cover is added to the viewport meta tag
CSS uses env(safe-area-inset-top), env(safe-area-inset-bottom), etc. for header and main content padding
Content is not obscured by the notch, rounded corners, or home indicator bar
Works correctly in both portrait and landscape orientation

userStories.title: Complete the web app manifest
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a complete PWA manifest so that the app is installable on all platforms with proper branding.
acceptanceCriteria: start_url is set to / (root redirects to detected locale)
scope is set to /
description field is added (e.g., "Create and share wishlists. All affiliate revenue goes to charity.")
id field is set (e.g., /)
categories field includes ["shopping", "lifestyle"]
A maskable icon is added ("purpose": "maskable") — may require generating a new icon with safe zone padding
screenshots array is added with at least one mobile and one desktop screenshot (for richer install UI on Android)
shortcuts array is added with at least "Dashboard" and "Create list" entries
Manifest validates with no errors on Chrome DevTools > Application > Manifest

userStories.title: Add iOS PWA meta tags and splash screens
userStories.description: As an iOS user, I want the app to look native when added to my home screen — with a proper splash screen and status bar styling.
acceptanceCriteria: <meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes"> is added
<meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-status-bar-style" content="default"> is added (white status bar to match the white header)
<meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-title" content="GiveTwice"> is added
Apple splash screen images are generated for major iPhone/iPad sizes and linked with <link rel="apple-touch-startup-image">
Splash screen uses GiveTwice branding (coral accent, logo on cream background)
App opens without a blank white flash on iOS when launched from home screen

userStories.title: Create and register the service worker
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a service worker that enables installability, offline caching, and is structured for future push notification support.
acceptanceCriteria: A service worker file is created (e.g., public/sw.js)
Service worker is registered from app.js (with scope /)
Uses a cache-first strategy for static assets (CSS, JS, fonts, images)
Uses a network-first strategy for HTML pages (API/page requests)
Caches the app shell on install (layout CSS/JS, key fonts, logo)
Includes a fetch event handler (required for Chrome installability)
Service worker updates gracefully (new version activates, old caches are cleaned up)
push and notificationclick event stubs are present (empty handlers, ready for future implementation)
Works correctly with Vite's hashed asset filenames (cache busting)

userStories.title: Offline fallback page
userStories.description: As a user who loses connectivity, I want to see a friendly offline page instead of a browser error so that I know the app is still "there."
acceptanceCriteria: An offline fallback page is created (e.g., resources/views/offline.blade.php or a static HTML file)
Page uses GiveTwice branding (logo, cream background, coral accent)
Shows a message like "You're offline. Your recently viewed lists are still available below."
Page is pre-cached by the service worker during installation
Service worker serves this page when a navigation request fails and no cached version exists

userStories.title: Cache recently viewed lists and gifts for offline browsing
userStories.description: As a user, I want to browse wishlists I recently viewed even when I'm offline so that I can reference gift ideas without an internet connection.
acceptanceCriteria: Public list pages (/{locale}/v/{id}/{slug}) are cached after first visit
Dashboard page is cached after first visit
Authenticated list detail pages (/{locale}/list/{slug}) are cached after first visit
Gift images are cached (at least the card conversion size)
Cache has a size limit (e.g., max 50 pages, max 100 images) with LRU eviction
Cached pages are served when offline with a subtle "viewing offline" indicator
Cache is invalidated/refreshed when the user visits the page while online

userStories.title: Smart install banner
userStories.description: As a user, I want to be prompted to install GiveTwice on my home screen so that I can access it quickly like a native app.
acceptanceCriteria: On Android/Chrome: intercepts the beforeinstallprompt event and shows a custom banner/button
On iOS Safari: detects standalone capability and shows an instruction banner ("Tap Share, then Add to Home Screen")
Banner is dismissible and doesn't show again for at least 7 days after dismissal (stored in localStorage)
Banner doesn't show if the app is already running in standalone mode (display-mode: standalone media query)
Banner appears after the user has visited at least 2 pages (not on first page load — avoid annoying first-time visitors)
Banner matches GiveTwice branding (uses coral CTA button, cream background)
Banner is positioned at the bottom of the screen, above the footer, and doesn't block content

userStories.title: Handle iOS standalone mode navigation quirks
userStories.description: As an iOS user running GiveTwice from my home screen, I want navigation to work smoothly without opening Safari unexpectedly.
acceptanceCriteria: External links (e.g., affiliate URLs on gifts) open in an in-app browser or Safari, not replace the PWA
Internal navigation stays within the standalone PWA (no Safari redirect)
The back button / swipe-back gesture works as expected in standalone mode
OAuth flows (Google/Facebook/Apple login) work correctly in standalone mode (may need target="_blank" or redirect handling)
Deep links from emails/notifications open within the PWA if installed

userStories.title: Systematic mobile QA pass
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to verify every page looks correct on mobile devices after all responsive changes.
acceptanceCriteria: Every page has been checked at 320px, 375px, and 428px viewport widths (small, medium, large phone)
No horizontal overflow on any page
All interactive elements have minimum 44x44px touch targets
Text is readable without zooming (minimum 16px for body text, 14px for secondary text)
Forms don't trigger unwanted zoom on iOS (input font-size >= 16px)
Tested in Chrome DevTools mobile emulation AND on a real iOS device (Safari)
PWA install flow tested on both iOS Safari and Android Chrome
Offline mode tested: airplane mode after caching pages, verify cached lists load
